step_data.action:
stop('I found information about text resizing in iOS and Android for mobile accessibility. Here's a summary:

**iOS Text Resizing:**
- Users can use Full Screen Zoom or Window Zoom to magnify parts of the screen
- Developers should use dynamic type to enable text resizing
- Avoid manually limiting text scaling as it may cause accessibility issues
- Minimum font size for body text should be 17pt

**Android Text Resizing:**
- Android Emulator can be used to preview apps on different devices
- Use scale-independent pixels (sp) for text sizing
- No equivalent to iOS Dynamic Type exists, so developers must scale text at different sizes manually
- Material design provides resources for type scaling
- Minimum font size for body text should be 16sp
- Make content containers scrollable to prevent cutting off content when zoomed

**HTML in Mobile Apps:**
- Use relative units for responsive design
- Avoid using maximum-scale=1.0 in meta elements as it prevents pinch-to-zoom functionality
- Ensure content reflows properly to avoid horizontal scrolling (WCAG 1.4.10)')
